SEARCH
Package edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.utils

Class InterfaceUtils

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.utils.InterfaceUtils
public final class InterfaceUtils extends Object
A utility class containing methods for interacting with the user, meant to be used in conjunction with a text based user interface, like TextUserInterface.

Provides methods for printing welcome and goodbye messages, handling errors, and for interacting with the user through the console, such as inputting integers, doubles strings, and dates. Also provides methods for printing menu and sub-menus, and for exiting the application.

Since:
0.2
Author:
WilliamHoltsdalen
See Also:
  • TextUserInterface

    • integerInput

      public static int integerInput()
      Reads an integer input from the console. If the input is not a valid integer, the method will print an error message and prompt the user to try again. It will continue to prompt the user until a valid integer is entered.
      Returns:
      the integer input read from the console

    • doubleInput

      public static double doubleInput()
      Reads a double input from the console. If the input is not a valid double, the method will print an error message and prompt the user to try again. It will continue to prompt the user until a valid double is entered.
      Returns:
      the double input read from the console

    • stringInput

      public static String stringInput()
      Reads a string input from the console. If the input is not a valid string, the method will print an error message and prompt the user to try again. It will continue to prompt the user until a valid string is entered.
      Returns:
      the string input read from the console

    • dateInput

      public static LocalDate dateInput()
      Reads a date input from the console. If the input is not a valid date, the method will print an error message and prompt the user to try again. It will continue to prompt the user until a valid date is entered.
      Returns:
      the date input read from the console
